channel.description: Recent content in oop on Adam Hartleb

item.title: Intro to Object Oriented Programming
item.description: Introduction What exactly is an object? An object is defined by two components: properties and behaviors. A car has properties like its color, the year it was made, if it’s 4WD or not, etc. It also has behaviors such as starting, driving and so on. Having both of these components is key because if you just have behaviors then you’re simply dealing with functions that transform their inputs and return the output.
